doc.after: Born in 1541, in either the village of Fodele or Candia (the Venetian name of Chandax, present day Heraklion) on Crete,[c] El Greco was descended from a prosperous urban family, which had probably been driven out of Chania to Candia after an uprising against the Venetians between 1526 and 1528.[5] El Greco's father, GeÃ³rgios TheotokÃ³poulos (d. 1556), was a merchant and tax collector. Nothing is known about his mother or his first wife, also Greek.[6] El Greco's older brother, ManoÃºssos TheotokÃ³poulos (1531Â â 13 December 1604), was archant and spent the last years of his life (1603â1604) in El Greco's Toledo home.[7]
